page.title: 05Description of Newburgh
page.content: Newburgh is a very pleasant rural settlement. It lies on either side of the A5209 which leads to the M6 at Wrightington and is frequently used by heavy vehicles. The population is 1125 with only a few local employers _ a chicken factory, a fruit farm, mushroom farm, and a garden nursery. These jobs give an indication of the rural nature of the area. There is one public house, the 'Red Lion'.There is a hairdresser's, a village grocery shop and a shop selling riding equipment. There is one Church of England church and a primary school that has 70 pupils at the moment. Children of secondary school age are bussed into neighbouring areas, mainly Burscough and Ormskirk.
